Title: Examination of Ethical Principles for LLM-Based Recommendations in Conversational AI
Abstract: conversational interfaces allow users to experience artificial intelligence  artificial intelliegence  services through text or voice conversations. one common form of a conversational interface is a chatbot which can be scenario based or large language model  large language model  based. a scenario based chatbot generates a response within a predefined scenario for a user query on a specific domain or topic. the chatbot response for recommendation is processed in conjunction with a separate algorithm. a large language model based chatbot generates a response through a pretrained model to a user query on a wide range of topics. in this process the large language model based chatbot response takes the form of a kind of recommendation which is different from the existing recommendation services. to look at the issue more comprehensively this paper examines recommendation style system responses of a large language model based chatbot with the principles of artificial intelliegence ethics. several examples are shown where the chatbot responses are modified according to principles of artificial intelliegence ethics.
